intro: Glochidion emarginatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf glabrous vine, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered in umbels, and its fruits are capsule-like structures containing numerous tiny seeds. Glochidion emarginatum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its native habitats.
